content: What About Credit Growth?  • Replicate prior evidence that sustained growth in bank credit predicts  future economic downturns- “credit booms go bust.” Schularick & Taylor (2012); Jorda, Schularick & Taylor (2013)  • In a horse race, credit-market sentiment drives out bank credit growth.  • Implications: • Not necessarily a different story. • Bond market variables may be a better proxy for sentiment. • Though suggestive of disruptions not just in bank loan supply, but also in   wider supply of credit.
